FailureFailureCode.description:
- RESERVED: The numbers assigned in this enumeration match the failure codes as
defined in BOLT #4. Because protobuf 3 requires enums to start with 0,
a RESERVED value is added.
 - INTERNAL_FAILURE: An internal error occurred.
 - UNKNOWN_FAILURE: The error source is known, but the failure itself couldn't be decoded.
 - UNREADABLE_FAILURE: An unreadable failure result is returned if the received failure message
cannot be decrypted. In that case the error source is unknown.

PeerSyncType.description:
- UNKNOWN_SYNC: Denotes that we cannot determine the peer's current sync type.
 - ACTIVE_SYNC: Denotes that we are actively receiving new graph updates from the peer.
 - PASSIVE_SYNC: Denotes that we are not receiving new graph updates from the peer.

network in a forwards compatible manner.

lnrpcCommitmentType.description:
- LEGACY: A channel using the legacy commitment format having tweaked to_remote
keys.
 - STATIC_REMOTE_KEY: A channel that uses the modern commitment format where the key in the
output of the remote party does not change each state. This makes back
up and recovery easier as when the channel is closed, the funds go
directly to that key.
 - ANCHORS: A channel that uses a commitment format that has anchor outputs on the
commitments, allowing fee bumping after a force close transaction has
been broadcast.
 - UNKNOWN_COMMITMENT_TYPE: Returned when the commitment type isn't known or unavailable.

An optional set of key-value TLV records. This is useful within the context
of the SendToRoute call as it allows callers to specify arbitrary K-V pairs
to drop off at each hop within the onion.

An optional TLV record that signals the use of an MPP payment. If present,
the receiver will enforce that that the same mpp_record is included in the
final hop payload of all non-zero payments in the HTLC set. If empty, a
regular single-shot payment is or was attempted.

here as well.

invoice was created with a zero value, then we need to record what amount

multiChanBackup.description:
A single encrypted blob containing all the static channel backups of the
channel listed above. This can be stored as a single file or blob, and
safely be replaced with any prior/future versions. When using REST, this
field must be encoded as base64.

numZombieChans.description: The number of edges marked as zombies.

channels.description: A list of all public channels for the node.

node.description:
An individual vertex/node within the channel graph. A node is
connected to other nodes by one or more channel edges emanating from it. As
the graph is directed, a node will also have an incoming edge attached to
it for each outgoing edge.

numChannels.description: The total number of channels for the node.

totalCapacity.description: The sum of all channels capacity for the node, denominated in satoshis.

betweennessCentrality.description:
Betweenness centrality is the sum of the ratio of shortest paths that pass
through the node for each pair of nodes in the graph (not counting paths
starting or ending at this node).
Map of node pubkey to betweenness centrality of the node. Normalized
values are in the [0,1] closed interval.

from.description:
The sending node of the pair. When using REST, this field must be encoded as
base64.

to.description:
The receiving node of the pair. When using REST, this field must be encoded
as base64.

chanOpen.description:
Signals that the channel's funding transaction has now reached the
required number of confirmations on chain and can be used.

chanPending.description:
Signals that the channel is now fully negotiated and the funding
transaction published.

pendingChanId.description:
The pending channel ID of the created channel. This value may be used to
further the funding flow manually via the FundingStateStep method.

psbtFund.description:
Signals that the funding process has been suspended and the construction
of a PSBT that funds the channel PK script is now required.

outputIndex.description: The index of the output on the transaction.

txidBytes.description: Raw bytes representing the transaction id.

txidStr.description: Reversed, hex-encoded string representing the transaction id.

creationTimeNs.description: The time in UNIX nanoseconds at which the payment was created.

feeMsat.title: The fee paid for this payment in milli-satoshis

feeSat.title: The fee paid for this payment in satoshis

htlcs.description: The HTLCs made in attempt to settle the payment.

paymentIndex.description:
The creation index of this payment. Each payment can be uniquely identified
by this index, which may not strictly increment by 1 for payments made in
older versions of lnd.

paymentRequest.description: The optional payment request being fulfilled.

valueMsat.title: The value of the payment in milli-satoshis

valueSat.title: The value of the payment in satoshis

lnrpcPaymentFailureReason.description:
- FAILURE_REASON_NONE: Payment isn't failed (yet).
 - FAILURE_REASON_TIMEOUT: There are more routes to try, but the payment timeout was exceeded.
 - FAILURE_REASON_NO_ROUTE: All possible routes were tried and failed permanently. Or were no
routes to the destination at all.
 - FAILURE_REASON_ERROR: A non-recoverable error has occured.
 - FAILURE_REASON_INCORRECT_PAYMENT_DETAILS: Payment details incorrect (unknown hash, invalid amt or
invalid final cltv delta)
 - FAILURE_REASON_INSUFFICIENT_BALANCE: Insufficient local balance.

address.title: Network address of the peer; eg `127.0.0.1:10011`

bytesRecv.title: Bytes of data transmitted from this peer

bytesSent.title: Bytes of data transmitted to this peer

errors.description:
The latest errors received from our peer with timestamps, limited to the 10
most recent errors. These errors are tracked across peer connections, but
are not persisted across lnd restarts. Note that these errors are only
stored for peers that we have channels open with, to prevent peers from
spamming us with errors at no cost.

features.description: Features advertised by the remote peer in their init message.

inbound.title: A channel is inbound if the counterparty initiated the channel

pubKey.title: The identity pubkey of the peer

syncType.description: The type of sync we are currently performing with this peer.

pubKey.description: The identity pubkey of the peer.

pendingClosingChannels.description:
Deprecated: Channels pending closing previously contained cooperatively
closed channels with a single confirmation. These channels are now
considered closed from the time we see them on chain.

totalLimboBalance.title: The balance in satoshis encumbered in pending channels

waitingCloseChannels.title: Channels waiting for closing tx to confirm

amount.title: The total value of the htlc

blocksTilMaturity.description:
The number of blocks remaining until the current stage can be swept.
Negative values indicate how many blocks have passed since becoming
mature.

incoming.title: The direction within the channel that the htlc was sent

maturityHeight.title: The next block height at which we can spend the current stage

outpoint.title: The final output to be swept back to the user's wallet

stage.title: Indicates whether the htlc is in its first or second stage of recovery

basePsbt.description:
An optional base PSBT the new channel output will be added to. If this is
non-empty, it must be a binary serialized PSBT.

noPublish.description:
If a channel should be part of a batch (multiple channel openings in one
transaction), it can be dangerous if the whole batch transaction is
published too early before all channel opening negotiations are completed.
This flag prevents this particular channel from broadcasting the transaction
after the negotiation with the remote peer. In a batch of channel openings
this flag should be set to true for every channel but the very last.

pendingChanId.description:
A unique identifier of 32 random bytes that will be used as the pending
channel ID to identify the PSBT state machine when interacting with it and
on the wire protocol to initiate the funding request.

routes.description:
The route that results from the path finding operation. This is still a
repeated field to retain backwards compatibility.

successProb.title:
The success probability of the returned route based on the current mission
control state. [EXPERIMENTAL]

fundingAddress.description:
The P2WSH address of the channel funding multisig address that the below
specified amount in satoshis needs to be sent to.

fundingAmount.description:
The exact amount in satoshis that needs to be sent to the above address to
fund the pending channel.

psbt.description:
A raw PSBT that contains the pending channel output. If a base PSBT was
provided in the PsbtShim, this is the base PSBT with one additional output.
If no base PSBT was specified, this is an otherwise empty PSBT with exactly
one output.

amountSat.description: The amount that was claimed by the resolution.

outcome.description: The outcome of our on chain action that resolved the outpoint.

outpoint.description: The outpoint that was spent by the resolution.

resolutionType.description: The type of output we are resolving.

sweepTxid.description:
The hex-encoded transaction ID of the sweep transaction that spent the
output.

lnrpcResolutionOutcome.description:
- OUTCOME_UNKNOWN: Outcome unknown.
 - CLAIMED: An output was claimed on chain.
 - UNCLAIMED: An output was left unclaimed on chain.
 - ABANDONED: ResolverOutcomeAbandoned indicates that an output that we did not
claim on chain, for example an anchor that we did not sweep and a
third party claimed on chain, or a htlc that we could not decode
so left unclaimed.
 - FIRST_STAGE: If we force closed our channel, our htlcs need to be claimed in two
stages. This outcome represents the broadcast of a timeout or success
transaction for this two stage htlc claim.
 - TIMEOUT: A htlc was timed out on chain.

lnrpcResolutionType.description:
- ANCHOR: We resolved an anchor output.
 - INCOMING_HTLC: We are resolving an incoming htlc on chain. This if this htlc is
claimed, we swept the incoming htlc with the preimage. If it is timed
out, our peer swept the timeout path.
 - OUTGOING_HTLC: We are resolving an outgoing htlc on chain. If this htlc is claimed,
the remote party swept the htlc with the preimage. If it is timed out,
we swept it with the timeout path.
 - COMMIT: We force closed and need to sweep our time locked commitment output.

lnrpcRoute.description:
A path through the channel graph which runs over one or more channels in
succession. This struct carries all the information required to craft the
Sphinx onion packet, and send the payment along the first hop in the path. A
route is only selected as valid if all the channels have sufficient capacity to
carry the initial payment amount after fees are accounted for.

hops.description: Contains details concerning the specific forwarding details at each hop.

totalAmt.description:
The total amount of funds required to complete a payment over this route.
This value includes the cumulative fees at each hop. As a result, the HTLC
extended to the first-hop in the route will need to have at least this many
satoshis, otherwise the route will fail at an intermediate node due to an
insufficient amount of fees.

totalFees.description:
The sum of the fees paid at each hop within the final route. In the case
of a one-hop payment, this value will be zero as we don't need to pay a fee
to ourselves.

totalTimeLock.description:
The cumulative (final) time lock across the entire route. This is the CLTV
value that should be extended to the first hop in the route. All other hops
will decrement the time-lock as advertised, leaving enough time for all
hops to wait for or present the payment preimage to complete the payment.

hopHints.description:
A list of hop hints that when chained together can assist in reaching a
specific destination.

txid.title: The transaction ID of the transaction

signature.title: The signature for the given message

error.description: The string representation of the error sent by our peer.

timestamp.description: The unix timestamp in seconds when the error occurred.

amount.title: The transaction amount, denominated in satoshis

blockHash.title: The hash of the block this transaction was included in

blockHeight.title: The height of the block this transaction was included in

destAddresses.title: Addresses that received funds for this transaction

label.description: A label that was optionally set on transaction broadcast.

transactions.description: The list of transactions relevant to the wallet.

amountSat.title: The value of the unspent coin in satoshis

confirmations.title: The number of confirmations for the Utxo

pubkey.title: The pubkey recovered from the signature

valid.title: Whether the signature was valid over the given message

confirmedBalance.title: The confirmed balance of a wallet(with >= 1 confirmations)

unconfirmedBalance.title: The unconfirmed balance of a wallet(with 0 confirmations)
